Dear Ms. Crawford:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Cathrine Raftery, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv)Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 6/21/22, staff recorded as youth fought another youth in the
common area. After recording, Staff was heard calling youth a
“retard,” a “bitch,” and making threats of family beating up youth.
Youth reported the incident to the therapist. The therapist talked
with the owner about correcting the problem instead of reporting it.
Investigation Interviews:
Complaint Source 1 is from an anonymous source.
Complaint Source 2 was interviewed via phone on June 26,
2023. Complaint Source 2 is Youth A’s adoption worker. She
reported on June 23, 2023, she did a home visit with Youth A who
disclosed there was a staff member there calling him names and
that made him upset. There were no other concerns noted and the
adoption worker felt there was a good level of supervision at the
facility.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on June
30, 2023. Youth A reported that the staff are decent at the facility
and noted he trusts Administrator 1. He reported Staff 3 has told
him the other staff members are afraid of him because he is from
Detroit and knew his history of getting into trouble. When asked
about the incident that occurred on June 21, 2023, Youth A did not
want to speak about it. He reported Staff 1 had asked to put away
his shoes and he did not want to so Staff 2 tossed his shoes into
his bedroom. Youth A reported this made him upset and then
heard Youth B ask Staff 1 if Youth B should strangle Youth A and
Staff 1 giggled. This increased Youth A's anger and he went to
2

confront Youth B about the situation. Youth A reported Youth B
then tried to elbow him, and Youth A was not going to back down.
He stated at this point Staff 1 grabbed her phone to record the
situation. Youth B sat down, and Staff 1 stopped recording. Youth
A reported Staff 1 called him “a bitch and retard”. He stated it was
not a big deal because it was just words and he laughed at Staff 1.
Youth A reported Staff 1 threatened to have her family come “dog
walk” him and noted that it meant for them to come to beat him up.
Youth A reported he did not understand why she was making
threats like this because he was just trying to go to camp that day.
Youth A reported he does not believe Staff 1 and Staff 2 like him.
He stated after the incident he went outside to sit on the porch and
wait for Administrator 1 to get there.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on June
30, 2023. Youth B reported he has been at the facility for almost
two months and knows Youth A from a previous placement. He
reported that he feels safe at the facility, and he has no concerns
with how staff treat the youth. Youth B reported Youth A got upset
the other day over shoes and began to threaten Youth B. He
reported at one point he was just trying to watch tv and Youth A
continued to stand over him and threaten that he was going to
fight him. Youth B reported Staff 1 and Staff 2 handled the
situation appropriately by trying to verbally de-escalate the
situation. He reported he never heard a staff member swear at
Youth A, call him names, or threaten Youth A.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 30,
2023. Staff 1 reported Youth A has been trying to test limits within
the program since he arrived. She reported staff have been told
consistency is key with Youth A and to follow the rules within the
home. She reported she has had concerns with Staff 3 showing
favoritism to Youth A and telling others he reminds her of herself
as a youth. Staff 1 reported the day before the incident in
question, Youth A struggled at a meeting with outside providers
and attempted to AWOL. She stated before her shift on June 21,
2023, she read the email of the incident that occurred the day
prior, and due to that incident she attempted to not get into any
power struggles with Youth A. Staff 1 reported the morning of
June 21, 2023, she was getting breakfast made for the youth in
the home and Youth A came out of his room and threw his shoes
in the living room area. She reported she asked Youth A if he was
okay and he did not answer. Staff 1 then asked him politely to
move his shoes and he just continued to ignore her. Staff 2 then
tried to interact with Youth A to encourage him to move his shoes
which did not work. She reported Staff 2 then put Youth A’s shoes
3

in Youth A’s room. Youth A came out again and threw his shoes,
so Staff 2 put his shoes in the staff office. Youth A got upset and
tried to get into the staff’s office, which youth are not allowed to go
in. Staff 1 reported Youth A would not talk with staff and continued
to point at his shoes and Staff 1 encouraged him to step out of the
staff’s office. She was able to exit the office and continued to work
with Youth B to get the chores completed around the house. Staff
1 reported Youth B was trying to make jokes about the vacuum
not working and at the time Youth A had exited the staff office.
Staff 2 had closed the staff office door and Youth A began to
pound on it. Youth A turned to Youth B and began to make threats
about beating him up. Youth B stated if Youth A was to hit him
then he would hit back. Staff 1 reported Youth A then became
more threatening and walked towards Youth B and Staff 1
grabbed out her phone to record the situation. She reported she
was concerned Youth A was going to fight Youth B and wanted to
show Administrator 1, which is why she pulled out her phone.
Youth A attempted to throw the centerpiece from the living room
table and made Staff 1 and Youth B flinch. Staff 2 came out from
the office and Youth A continued to threaten everyone. Staff 1
stated Staff 2 had Administrator 1 on the phone to help calm the
situation down. She reported Administrator 1 coached Youth A to
sit on the porch to take a break. Staff 1 reported once Youth A
went to the porch, Staff 4 came on to shift after the events were
over. She reported she did talk with Staff 2 in private, but no youth
were around, stating that she does not come to this job to be
called “bitches and hoes” or get threatened. Staff 1 reported this
was never around any youth or in an area they could hear it. She
reported she never called Youth A retarded, bitch, or threatened
Youth A. Staff 1 reported they are encouraged to help verbally de-
escalate the youth when they are heightened and to call
Administrator 1 or the police when in a situation like this.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 30,
2023. Staff 2 reported she just started working at the facility about
two months ago but has experience working within group homes.
She reported she worked on June 21, 2023, with Staff 1 and was
present for the incident in question. Staff 2 reported when she
arrived at the home, she noticed Youth A's shoes had been
thrown and Staff 1 was asking Youth A to move his shoes. She
stated Youth A was not responding to Staff 1 so instead of getting
into a power struggle, Staff 2 told Youth A she was just going to
move his shoes and bring them into him his room, which she did.
She reported she went back to cleaning up the home and Youth A
brought his shoes out again at this point, Staff 2 decided to bring
the shoes into the staff office because Youth A was refusing to
4

speak with staff. She reported she went back to working on things
and then heard Youth A take all of his shoes and throw them into
the living area. Staff 2 reported she brought all the shoes into the
staff office and she closed the door. She reported she stayed in
the office for a little bit to catch up on paperwork and Youth A
began to pound on the office door. Staff 2 opened the office door
and Youth A continued to not verbally respond to Staff 2 and
would just point at his shoes. She reported Youth A walked into
the staff office where youth are not allowed to be in the office due
to confidentiality and other items they keep in the office. She
stated that she continued to give Youth A choices and tried to get
him out of the office. She reported Youth B was in the kitchen area
as well during this time and was speaking with Staff 1. Staff 2
reported Youth A began to call Staff 1 a “bitch” and began to get
frustrated with Youth B. She reported Youth A began to walk
around the kitchen area with his hands in a fist and started to test
boundaries. Youth A walked into the kitchen without asking for
permission and when redirected, Youth A reported Staff 3 lets him
do this whenever he wants. Youth A kept getting closer to Staff 1.
Youth A was threatening them and Staff 1 continued to ask Youth
A for personal space. Youth B then began to state if Youth A hits
him he is going to hit Youth A back. At that point, Staff 1 noted she
was going to record the situation on the phone and told Youth A
she was doing this for the personal safety of herself and Youth B.
Staff 2 reported Youth B was told not to engage in the situation
and Youth A put on all of his rings to continue to make threats that
he was going to fight someone. Staff 2 reported she continued to
call Administrator 1 at this time and Youth B went to sit in the
living room area to watch tv and not engage in the situation. Staff
2 reported Youth A continued to hover over Youth B and Staff 2
encouraged Youth A to give some space. Youth A attempted to
pick up the glass centerpiece on the table and threatened to throw
it at Youth B. Staff 2 was able to get Administrator 1 on the phone
who was able to talk with Youth A on speaker phone. Youth A
listened to Administrator 1 and took a break to sit outside on the
porch while he came. Staff 2 reported she was able to see Youth
A sit on the porch through the window and Youth B went to his
room. She reported when there was no youth around, Staff 1
began to cry over the situation as she was flooded with emotions.
Staff 2 reported Staff 1 stated that she does not come to this job to
get threatened by the youth or get called a “bitch” by the youth.
Staff 2 reported Staff 1 never told Youth A he was a “bitch” or
“retarded” and never threatened him. She reported Staff 4 arrived
at the facility and talked with Youth A while he was waiting for
Administrator 1. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 attempted to continue to
5

verbally de-escalate the situation and make sure everyone was
safe.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 30,
2023. Staff 4 reported she was working during the time the
incident occurred. She reported she came onto shift when Youth A
was out on the patio. Staff 4 reported Administrator 1 was on he
way to see Youth A and talk with Staff 1. She reported she did not
hear any concerns from Youth A about Staff 1 swearing at him or
threatening him. Staff 4 reported it is in their code of conduct that
they are not allowed to yell, swear or threaten youth.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on June
30, 2023. Therapist reported she was not there for the event when
it occurred. She reported she spoke with Youth A the day after the
incident and he reported Staff 1 had called him a “retard”, a
“bitch”, and made threats that her family was going to come beat
him up. Therapist reported once she completed the therapy
sessions with Youth A, she consulted Administrator 1 about these
complaints which started the internal investigations. Therapist
reported Youth A has never made any other complaints about
staff at the facility but also has only been at the facility for about a
month. She reported Youth A has had some behavioral issues
since being at the facility which were noted to be more trauma-
related responses and behavioral concerns.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on June 30, 2023. Staff 3
reported she recently quit working at the facility and noted she
feels the facility is not equipped to meet Youth A’s needs. She
reported she was not present for the incident that occurred on
June 21, 2023. Staff 3 reported she spoke with Youth A the next
day and he told her Staff 1 had threatened him, swore, and called
him names. She reported she feels bad for Youth A due to his life
experiences and being in the system for this long. Staff 3 reported
she has never heard any staff at the facility swear in front of the
youth, call them names, or threaten them.
Administrator 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
June 26, 2023. Administrator 1 reported he talked with Youth A on
June 21, 2023, and told him to calm down by going out on the
deck. He reported he spoke with Youth A the day of the incident
and no concerns were reported to him of any name-calling or
threats. Administrator 1 reported therapist brought this concern up
to him on June 21, 2023 from Youth A reporting this to therapist.
He reported he completed an internal investigation and found Staff
1 did not call Youth A “retard” or “bitch” or made threats of her
6

family to come to beat up the resident. He reported Youth B was
present as well and reported this did not occur.
Administrator 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
June 30, 2023. Administrator 2 reported she was not present for
the events that occurred on June 21, 2023, and was out on
vacation. She reported when she came back from vacation due to
the concerns Therapist brought up from Youth A an internal
investigation was completed. Administrator 2 reported she spoke
with Youth A about the incident, and he continued to report his
feelings that Staff 1 and Staff 2 do not like him. She reported
Youth A identified Administrator 1 as his main support staff
member at the facility.
Documentation Reviewed:
- Facility Incident Report dated 06/21/2023 completed by
Staff 1- This incident report was consistent with the
interview completed with Staff 1 and completed in a timely
manner.
- Facility Incident Report dated 06/21/2023 completed by
Staff 2- This incident report was consistent with the
interview completed with Staff 2 and completed in a timely
manner.
- Facility Discipline Policy dated 05/18/2020- Policy notes
the facility prohibits all cruel and severe disciple, including
any of the following: verbal abuse, ridicule, or humiliation.
- Facility No Touch Policy dated 04/18/2020- Policy notes
that staff should not touch a youth at any time. Staff are to
only use verbal de-escalation techniques with an escalated
youth and attempt to redirect them. Staff should contact on
call support when needed. It appears that Staff 1 and Staff
2 followed the policy per the interviews conducted.
- Human Resource File for Staff 1- There is no disciplinary
actions noted within Staff 1’s HR file. She completed all
required trainings noting her first skill and technique training
on 05/17/2022.
- Email from Law Enforcement dated 06/26/2023- Law
Enforcement will not be opening a case up with the facility.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with following the rule of not
using any verbal abuse toward a youth. Within the interviews there
7

was no evidence found of Staff 1 calling Youth A names or
threatening to get him hurt.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127 Staff-to-resident ratio
Section (1) The licensee shall develop and adhere to a written staff-to-child
Description ratio formula for direct care workers. If a child caring institution is
contracted by the department to care for youth, the facility will
follow its contracted ratio.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Also, five youth and one staff is on one shift which is believed to
be a violation.
Investigation Interviews:
Administrator 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
June 26, 2023. Administrator 1 reported the ratio currently at the
facility is one staff member to every four youth but tries to operate
at one staff member for every three youth. He reported they
currently have five youth within the program.
Administrator 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
June 30, 2023. Administrator 2 reported the facility has the best
practice to operate at a three youth to one staff member ratio and
their policy ratio is one staff member to every four youth. She
reported there have been no concerns of staff being out of ratio.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 30,
2023. Staff 1 reported the facility tries to stay within a three-youth-
to-one staff ratio as best practice. The ratio of the facility is one
staff to every four youth during waking hours. She reported there
are always two staff members on during waking hours.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 30,
2023. Staff 2 reported the ratio at the facility is one staff member
to every four youth. She reported the facility operates more so
with one staff to every three youth. Staff 2 reported she has never
seen a time at the facility where they were out of ratio and has no
concerns about this.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on June 30, 2023. Staff 3 did
not know exactly what the ratio policy was at the facility. She
reported she did not feel that there was enough staff at the facility
working to meet the needs of the youth.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 30,
2023. Staff 4 reported the ratio policy at the facility is one staff
8

member to every four youth. She reported there is always enough
staff working to be within the ratio and there have been no issues.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on June
30, 2023. Youth A reported there is always two staff on during the
time youth are awake and he stated he lives with four other males.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on June
30, 2023. Youth B reported he feels there is always enough staff
on shift to keep the youth safe. He reported there is five male
youth living at the facility right now and at least two different staff
members are working.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on June
30, 2023. Therapist reported she has never had a concern with
the number of staff being present at the facility for the youth’s
needs.
Documents Reviewed:
- Facility Staff to Resident Ratio Policy dated 05/18/2023-
The policy notes, “one direct care worker shall be
responsible for a maximum of four youths on each shift
during awake hours or per specific contract guidelines and
one staff shall be responsible for six youths during a sleep
hours.”
- Facility June Staffing Calendar- The facility has two staff
members scheduled on first shift and two staff members
scheduled on second shift for each day. It the license was
at full capacity this would meet the staffing requirements.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with their ratio policy. It was
found there is at least two staff members working during the
waking hours.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4130 Privacy and Confidentiality
Section (1) An institution shall assure resident and parent privacy and
Description confidentiality and shall protect residents from exploitation.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff were recording Youth A on personal phone.
Investigation Interviews:
Administrator 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
June 26, 2023. Administrator 1 reported he did find Staff 1
recorded Youth A on her phone when he was acting out
behaviorally. He reported Staff 1 did this because within their
9

policy it notes staff can do this to show the administrator team the
events occurring with the youth.
Administrator 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
June 30, 2023. Administrator 2 was able to note the internal policy
of recording youth at the facility. She reported the facility is very
strict about HIPPA regulations and noted staff are to show the
videos or photos of youth as soon as possible to the
administration team and then that video/photo is to immediately be
deleted. Administrator 2 reported this is only done by staff in
extreme situations.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on June
30, 2023. Youth A reported Staff 1 told him on June 21, 2023, she
was going to record him on her phone because of the behaviors
he was showing. He reported he was not concerned about being
recorded.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on June
30, 2023. Youth B reported he only has seen a staff member one
time record a youth on their personal phone. He reported this was
when Youth A was threatening Youth B and Staff 1. Youth B
stated Staff 1 told Youth A she was recording him because he was
having unsafe behavior and she needs to document this for
Administrator 1.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 30,
2023. Staff 1 reported within the policy a staff member can record
a youth to show the administration team if an incident is occurring.
She reported she recorded the incident because she believes
Youth A was going to fight Youth B.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 30,
2023. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 did briefly record the situation on
June 21, 2023, with Youth A. She reported Staff 1 was clear to
Youth A that she was recording to show Administrator 1 what was
occurring and for the safety of Youth B and herself. Staff 2
reported this was in line with the facility’s policy on recording.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 30,
2023. Staff 4 reported she was not present when Staff 1 was
recording Youth A on her personal device. She reported the
facility promotes HIPPA laws and makes sure the youth have
privacy. Staff 4 was unsure what the policy was on recording a
youth and noted that she would never record the youth.
10

Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on June
30, 2023. Therapist reported she is unaware of what the policy is
about recording a youth on a personal phone. She reported she
does not do this as she is working with the youth in a therapeutic
setting.
Licensing Consultant was interviewed via phone on July 5,
2023. Licensing consultant reported he was unaware of the
recording/videotape policy the facility has in place.
Documents Reviewed:
- Facility Recording/Videotape Policy Dated 04/18/2020-
This policy noted the following : “Pine Way Group staff will
not video tape or record any youth residing at the facility
(refer to Confidentiality & Privacy Policy) unless used for
training and/or educational purposes; Staff videotaping
youth on their devices may only share the recorded video
with Pine Way administrative staff for educational, training,
and documentation purposes; All recorded information
must be deleted from all devices immediately after
administrative review/training within seven business days,
whichever comes first; When possible, all staff and
administrators must rely on professionally installed audio-
video equipment owned by the home and maintained for at
least 30 days.”
- Facility Privacy and Confidentiality Policy dated
04/18/2023- This policy notes the following: “All staff will
receive training addressing privacy and confidentiality; To
the best of our ability the facility will supervise youth and
protect youth from exploitation in and outside of the home;
Pine Way Group Home will not disclose the identity of
youth for public purposes or publicity without the consent of
the parent and youth if the youth is capable of consenting;
Pine Way Group Home will adhere to all Health Information
Privacy and Protection Act (HIPPA) guidelines and
responsibilities to ensure the privacy and protection of
youth information as required by law.”
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance of the rule of privacy and
confidentially. The facility should not be allowing staff to record a
youth on their personal cell phone. Additionally recording a youth
when they are in crisis is not effective in deescalating the
situation.
Consultation:
11

Consultation was provided to the facility about the mental health
code and video surveillance due to the facility receiving funds from
community mental health.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & ACT 116 - 722.120 Investigation, inspection, and examination of
Section conditions, books, records, and reports; access by department,
Description bureau of fire services, or local authorities; records; reports
report; forms; confidentiality; disclosure of information;
availability of confidential records; child information cards to be
provided to department; failure of licensee to cooperation with
investigation, inspection or examination.;
(1) The department may investigate, inspect, and examine conditions
of a childcare organization and may investigate and examine the
books and records of the licensee. The licensee shall cooperate with
the department’s investigation, inspection, and examination by doing
all of the following:
(c) Providing accurate and truthful information to the department, and
encouraging witnesses, such as staff and household members, to
provide accurate and truthful information to the department.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 6/22/23, the owner met with staff and told everyone to write
incident reports on previous incidents that happened between staff
and the youth. There is recorded footage of the owner asking staff
to lie and exaggerate the incident reports to make the situations
look as if youth is “psychotic” and made up the story.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on June
30, 2023. Youth A reported he has never heard staff lie about him
and reported he feels the most supported by Administrator 1.
Administrator 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
June 26, 2023. Administrator 1 reported he did meet with Staff 1,
Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 4 about getting their reports completed
about the incidents due to him doing his internal review. He
reported he never told staff to lie about the incident. Administrator
1 reported he wanted to make sure that staff members were
getting the reports completed so that the Therapist can be
updated on all of the behaviors.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 30,
2023. Staff 1 reported she was in the meeting with Administrator 1
when he asked for all the incident reports. She reported he never
told staff to lie on the reports and make it seem like Youth A was
having a “psychotic episode”. Staff 1 reported Administrator 1 told
them to report what occurred so that the Therapist knew and there
12

was documentation of the situation. She reported the meeting was
being had because Staff 3 was not always documenting on Youth
A’s behaviors because she did not want him to get in trouble or
cause any stress within the home.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 30,
2023. Staff 2 reported she was present when Administrator 1 told
staff to complete the incident reporting on Youth A. She reported
Administrator 1 never told staff to lie about the situations or make
it look like Youth A was psychotic. Staff 2 reported staff were just
reminded of the importance of documenting these events. She
stated they have not had youth at the facility with these types of
behaviors before so it was just a reminder of the reason why these
needed to be done.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on June 30, 2023. Staff 3
reported she was present when Administrator 1 was telling staff
they need to complete the incident reports about Youth A. She
reported she felt Administrator 1 was being hard on Youth A and
felt that he just wanted all this information to build a case against
Youth A. Staff 3 reported she felt like she was being forced to
exaggerate the incidents and note that Youth A was having
psychotic breaks. She reported this was not fair to Youth A.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 30,
2023. Staff 4 reported she was a part of the meeting when
Administrator 1 told staff that incident reports needed to be done
on the behaviors of Youth A. She reported Administrator 1 had
this meeting because the Therapist needed to know this
information, and this was the policy they had at the facility. Staff 4
reported she was involved in this meeting because the day before
the incident in question she was transporting Youth A to an
appointment, and he got frustrated and was trying to AWOL. Staff
4 reported Administrator 1 told staff to make sure to report their
own truth of the situations and complete it timely.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on June
30, 2023. Therapist reported when she spoke to Administrator 1
about the concerns from Youth A, she asked for updated incident
reports from staff members. She reported she has never heard
Administrator 1 tell staff to lie about the documentation. Therapist
reported Youth A does show a lot of trauma response behavior
and previous youth they have had at the facility has not shown this
type of behavior which has made staff more concerned about
Youth A being at the facility.
13

Administrator 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
June 30, 2023. Administrator 2 reported there have been no
internal complaints from the staff of Administrator 1 telling staff to
lie about incident reports. She reported there has been
communication with staff to make sure incident reports were being
completed on the incidents occurring with Youth A. Administrator
2 reported there was an issue with Staff 3 not completing the
required incident reports.
